ingredients: 1 tsp whole pepper corns (sabut kali mirch)
1 green chili (chopped)                      1 tea bag                                                1 Tbsp butter
1/2 tsp yeast, dissolved for 10 minutes in luke warm water
instructions: For chole:
In a pan add oil, bay leaf, cinnamon, cumin seeds, cloves, whole pepper corns, green and black cardamom.
After it gets brown add chopped onions and saute it.
After sauteing add chopped ginger and garlic.
Then add turmeric, chili powder, coriander powder, cumin powder, asafoetida, salt and fry well.
For de glazing the pan add little water.
Now add the chole (soaked overnight and pressure cooked) to the masala.
After stirring well add tomatoes, little sugar and salt to the chole (chickpeas)
Now add ajwain, chopped green chilies and water for the base.
To get the color in the chole, add a tea bag to the masala.
Simmer the chole gently for an hour and cover it.
Add lime juice and a dollop of butter to it.
Garnish the chole with coriander and butter.
Serve the chole hot with bhaturas.
For the bhaturas:
Knead the whole wheat flour, maida and salt together with adequate amount of water.
Sprinkle the yeast on top. Leave it for 2-3 hours for the yeast to work.
Divide it into equal portions. Roll out in an oval or round shape.
Deep fry till golden brown, like a puri.
Serve.

name: Quick Chicken Curry
instructions: Heat oil in a pan and sauté the onion paste, garlic & ginger paste till golden brown.
Add tomato puree. When the tomato puree dries up, add coriander powder, cumin powder, garam masala, red chilli powder, turmeric powder and salt. Let the spices cook.
Add chicken pieces into the masala. Stir well and cook till they are golden brown.
Add 1/2 cup of water and stir. Cover with a lid and let it simmer till the chicken is cooked.
Garnish with chopped coriander and serve.

name: Butter Chicken
instructions: For marinating the chicken
In a mixing bowl, mix red chilli powder, ginger garlic paste, salt and curd.
Add the raw chicken pieces to the marinade and mix well. Keep it in the refrigerator overnight or minimum 6 hours.
Roast the marinated chicken in a tandoor or an oven for about 10-12 minutes until it is three-fourth done.
For the chicken gravy
Heat half the quantity of white butter in pan.
Pour in the tomato puree, and saute for 2-3 minutes. Add cumin seeds, sugar, red chilli powder and salt. Mix well.
Add the prepared chicken, white butter, fresh cream, sliced green chillies and crushed fenugreek leaves.  Saute for 3-4 minutes and let the chicken cook.
Cook till chicken is done. Serve hot with rice or naan.

name: Kaithine Pachile
instructions: Add mussels in a pan.
Add water with a little turmeric.
Boil for about 5 minutes.
Strain the water and remove the meat from mussel shell.
In a bowl, mix together mussels, lime juice, garlic paste, ginger paste, salt, egg, red chilli powder and garam masala.
Now coat mussels with semolina and deep fry.
Serve hot with green chutney

name: Salmon Fillet with Vegetables
instructions: Take a butter paper/parchment paper and lay fennel stems and lemon slices on it.
Place the fish on it and top with leeks. Season and add parsley, thyme and coriander seeds.
Finish with butter and fold the paper tightly leaving one side open.
Pour in the wine and then seal the paper completely. Place in a pan and bake for 10 minutes.
For the sauce, open the butter paper and separate the liquid from the fish on to a pan.
Heat it for 2 minutes and then add white wine. Now add thyme and butter.
Finally add the vegetable stock.
Place the fish on a serving dish, pour the sauce on top and serve.

name: Chilled Cucumber-Prawn Soup
instructions: Sprinkle salt on the grated cucumber and leave aside for 15 minutes.
Mix together the yoghurt, cream and cucumber.
Add lemon juice, capsicum, prawns and salt and pepper.
Chill for an hour before serving.

name: Kerala Prawn Soup
instructions: Roast peppercorns, mustard, curry leaves and fenugreek seeds. Grind to a fine powder.
Heat oil. Add onions; curry leaves, garlic and ginger. Stir and fry for 3 minutes.
Add a couple of tablespoons of water to prevent sticking.
Add dry masala and red chilli paste.
Cook for a few minutes before adding the stock.
Season and bring to a boil. Simmer for 15 minutes.
Add prawns and cook until tender.
Stir in lime juice and coconut milk. Heat through and serve.

name: Crisp Fried Prawns
ingredients: 25 gm flour oil for deep frying sauce
instructions: Mix prawns with soya, wine, sugar, garlic, ginger and eggs. Marinate it for 30 minutes.
Sprinkle in corn flour and flour. Stir to coat.
Then deep fry in hot oil until crisp and colored. Serve it with sauce.
4. For the Sauce:
Heat oil in a wok, and stir-fry chillies, garlic and spring onions for 30 seconds.
Combine remaining ingredients except sesame oil.
Stir to thicken, before adding sesame oil.
Serve with prawns.

name: Jhinga Pulao
ingredients: 1.5 tsp salt or to taste green chillies-chopped to taste
1 cup rice-soaked for half an hour
instructions: Cook the rice in 1 1/2 cups water till almost done, and keep aside.
Then heat the oil and add cumin.
When it splutters, add the onion, ginger and garlic and saute till onions are brown.
Add chilli powder, coriander, garam masala, turmeric and salt and mix well.
Add the green chillies and the shrimps, saute a little and add the coconut milk and half the coriander.
Simmer till prawns are almost done. Remove from heat.
Remove half the prawn mixture and arrange half the rice over the rest. Put the remaindered prawns over the rice and cover with the rest of the rice.
Then cover it and place over very low heat for 20-30 minutes.
Garnished it with the rest of the coriander and serve hot.

name: Prawn Biryani
ingredients: 1/4 cup fried onions oil to pan fry
instructions: Mix the turmeric, chilli powder, salt, ginger, garlic, onion, garam masala and 1/2 cup yogurt and marinate the prawns in it, for 1/2 an hour.
Then heat the oil and saute the prawn mixture in it over high heat, till brown.
Take off the heat and mix in the rest of the yogurt, cream, coriander and half the fried onions.
Place 1/2 the rice in a greased pan in a layer.
Add the fish mixture in a layer over this and cover with the rest of the rice.
Seal the pan and place over low heat for 20-30 minutes.
Serve hot garnished with the rest of the fried onions.

name: Kerala Fish Fry (Meen Varathathu)
ingredients: 500 gm fish - scaled and cut diagonally into 3cm pieces oil for frying
instructions: Wash fish, drain and keep aside.
Then add grind ginger, chilli powder, coriander, turmeric, methi, vinegar and salt into a paste.
Marinate the fish with the paste and keep aside for an hour.
Heat oil and fry the fish pieces till they turn light brown in colour.
Make sure that the flame is not too high.
Pierce the fish with a knife and if it flakes easily it is cooked.
Place the fish pieces on an absorbent paper to drain out the excess oil.
Serve hot.

name: Pan Fried Fish with Almonds
instructions: Season fish with salt and pepper.
Coat the fillets with flour. Then dip them in beaten eggs.
Fry fish on both sides in hot oil until golden brown.
Mix lemon juice, Worcestershire sauce and pour it on the fish.
Sauté almonds in butter with raisins and parsley, and pour over fish before serving.

name: Simple Fish Fry
ingredients: 1 kg fish-fillets and cut into thick slices
instructions: Marinate the fish in the salt and lemon juice for 15 minutes and then wash off and wipe dry.
Heat the oil, and when a piece of fish tossed in comes up at once, add 1/2 tsp salt and fry the fish-put in as many pieces as fit in comfortably without the pieces touching each other.
Turn pieces over and lower the heat. Cook till the pieces are an even brown.
Remove from oil, drain on an absorbent paper and serve hot, garnished with the garam masala.

name: Fish Mur-Moro
instructions: Grind together the red chillies, coriander, peppercorns, ginger, cumin, saffron, 3/4 cups onion, tamarind and the 6 cloves of garlic.
Heat the oil and add onions. Stir-fry till brown.
Add ground masala and stir-fry till fat separates.
Add the chopped tomato, green chillies and garlic and stir-fry till fat separates.
Add sugar and coriander leaves and remove from fire.
When cool enough to handle, smear masala on to the fish to cover the fish with it. Place the fish in the same pan.
Place the pan over live coals, cover with a lid and place live coals on the top of the lid too.
Leave this for 15- 20 minutes or till cooked through.
Please note this is a side dish so minimize the water added, as it has to be kept semi dry.

name: Butter Fried Scampi
ingredients: 2 onions julienned    12 cloves of garlic    1 stick of cinnamon    1 1/2 tsp cumin

1 1/2 tsp pepper corns    1 1/2 tsp coriander seeds    1 star anise    2 cloves    1/2 tsp fennel seeds    Salt to flavor    1 tsp chili powder    1 1/2 tsp turmeric powder    1 cup red wine vinegar    3 Tbsp sugar
instructions: For berry burry masala:
Add onion and garlic to a pre-heated pan. Then add red chillies, cinnamon, cumin, pepper corns, coriander seeds, star anise, cloves & fennel seeds and saute the spices.
Add salt and roast it all together.
Transfer the mixture into a blender and add turmeric & chili powder
Drizzle red wine vinegar, sugar and 3 Tbsp of oil and grind it all together.
Take out the paste in a bowl.
For butter fried scampi:
Cut the tiger prawns from the middle and take out the tail end.
Cut the back shell, remove the intestine and expose the flesh.
Flavour the prawns with berry burry masala and place in an oven dish.
Add butter and squeeze half a lemon.
Cook it away for 7-8 minutes on 180 degrees in a pre-heated oven.
Take it out and garnish with some chopped coriander.

name: Rava Fried Fish
ingredients: 3 fillets of Basa fish    2 tsp ginger garlic paste     50 ml refined oil    1 tsp red chili powder    2 lemons quartered     Pinch of salt    1/2 tsp turmeric powder
instructions: Take ginger garlic paste in a bowl and add chilli powder, turmeric and salt.
Drizzle 2 spoons of refined oil and mix it well.
Flavour the fish fillets with the paste and then coat the pieces with rava.
Add fair amount of refined oil in a preheat pan and shallow fry the fillets.
Lay some chopped coriander in a platter.
Serve the fillets into the platter with lemon pieces

name: Fish Orly
ingredients: 4 fillets of betki fish (you can use any other fish also)
instructions: Marinate fillets with ginger, garlic, onion, salt and vinegar for one hour.
Blend wheat flour, salt, corn flour, egg and baking powder in a bowl of water. Dip the fillets in the mixture and deep fry in oil.
Serve with chips and salad.

name: Doi Machch
ingredients: 500 gm fish (Rohu/Carp)-sliced into desired sized pieces; washed, wiped and rubbed
instructions: Mix together the curd, onion, ginger, garlic, chilli powder, turmeric and keep aside.
Heat oil and fry the fish over high heat till brown. Lift fish out of oil and keep aside.
In the same oil, add the bay leaves, cumin, cloves, cardamom and cinnamon. When the seeds splutter, add the curd mixture and saute till fat separates.
Add the fish and saute till cooked through, add sugar and salt and serve hot.

name: Prawn Pakoda
instructions: Drain the prawns well.
Mix the flour, garlic, salt, pepper, chillies, coriander and mango powder, in enough water, to form a smooth paste.
Then add enough water to make a pouring consistency (when lifted in a spoon and dropped, it should fall in a continuous smooth stream).
Heat the oil in a kadahi till a drop of batter dropped in comes up at once.
Dip the prawns in the batter and drop into the hot oil.
Fry over medium heat, to a very light brown.
Lift out with a slotted spoon and keep aside.
When ready to serve, heat the oil again and fry over high heat to a golden brown.
Remove from oil, drain on an absorbent paper, and serve with a chutney or ketchup.

name: Tomato Fish
instructions: Mix together, the lemon juice, salt, and ginger and garlic paste. Rub this into the fish to coat well. Cover and refrigerate for an hour.
Heat oil and add green chillies. Pan-fry the fish over high heat to just coat with oil.
Place fish in an oven proof dish.
Mix together the tomato puree and chilli powder. Pour this over the fish and bake in a pre-heated oven for 20-25 minutes.
Serve garnished with coriander leaves.

name: Fish Pakora
ingredients: 500 gm fish - filleted and cut into desired sized pieces
instructions: Marinate the fish pieces in the lemon juice and salt for 15 minutes, wash and place in a          colander to drain the water.
Make a thick batter with water, flour, red chilli powder, cumin, turmeric, salt and soda  bi-carbonate.
Coat each slice with the batter and deep fry.
Sprinkle with chaat masala and serve with ketchup or chutney.

name: Chocolate Cake in a Pressure Cooker
instructions: In a mixing bowl, sift the flour, cocoa powder and baking powder.
Add in the butter, sugar, salt, water and vanilla, and beat the ingredients using a whisk.
Add the eggs and beat the batter until smooth.
Transfer into the baking tin.
Heat the pressure cooker, covered with the lid but without the pressure, for 3-4 minutes on high heat, then place the cake tin in the empty cooker (do not add water in the cooker).
Close the lid (without the pressure), lower the flame and let it cook until done (about 30 minutes).

name: Honey Chilli Potatoes
instructions: For the potatoes:
In a bowl, add cornflour or maida, salt and red chilli powder.
Add the sliced potatoes and mix well until the potatoes are coated.
Heat oil in a wok and deep fry the potatoes until golden. Keep aside.
For the Base:
In a wok, add oil, garlic paste and spring onions. Saute on high heat for 1 minute.
Add capsicum, honey, salt, soya sauce, chilli sauce. Saute for 2-3 minutes.
Add the deep-fried potatoes and sesame seeds. Mix well and serve hot.

name: Vegetable Momos
instructions: Mix the maida, salt and baking powder and knead to a stiff dough with water.
Heat oil and add the onion and garlic.
Saute over high heat and add the carrot and cabbage. Turn around over high heat till glossy.
Take it off the heat and mix in the Soya sauce, salt, vinegar and black pepper.
Roll the dough thin (translucent) and cut into 4"-5" rounds.
Take a round, wet edges and place some filling in the center.
Bring edges together to cover the filling. Twist to seal and fill the rest in the same way.
Steam for about 10 minutes and serve with soya sauce and chilli sauce.

name: Chole Bhature
ingredients: 1 tsp whole pepper corns (sabut kali mirch)
1 green chili (chopped)                      1 tea bag                                                1 Tbsp butter
1/2 tsp yeast, dissolved for 10 minutes in luke warm water
instructions: For chole:
In a pan add oil, bay leaf, cinnamon, cumin seeds, cloves, whole pepper corns, green and black cardamom.
After it gets brown add chopped onions and saute it.
After sauteing add chopped ginger and garlic.
Then add turmeric, chili powder, coriander powder, cumin powder, asafoetida, salt and fry well.
For de glazing the pan add little water.
Now add the chole (soaked overnight and pressure cooked) to the masala.
After stirring well add tomatoes, little sugar and salt to the chole (chickpeas)
Now add ajwain, chopped green chilies and water for the base.
To get the color in the chole, add a tea bag to the masala.
Simmer the chole gently for an hour and cover it.
Add lime juice and a dollop of butter to it.
Garnish the chole with coriander and butter.
Serve the chole hot with bhaturas.
For the bhaturas:
Knead the whole wheat flour, maida and salt together with adequate amount of water.
Sprinkle the yeast on top. Leave it for 2-3 hours for the yeast to work.
Divide it into equal portions. Roll out in an oval or round shape.
Deep fry till golden brown, like a puri.
Serve.

name: Quick Chicken Curry
instructions: Heat oil in a pan and sauté the onion paste, garlic & ginger paste till golden brown.
Add tomato puree. When the tomato puree dries up, add coriander powder, cumin powder, garam masala, red chilli powder, turmeric powder and salt. Let the spices cook.
Add chicken pieces into the masala. Stir well and cook till they are golden brown.
Add 1/2 cup of water and stir. Cover with a lid and let it simmer till the chicken is cooked.
Garnish with chopped coriander and serve.

name: Butter Chicken
instructions: For marinating the chicken
In a mixing bowl, mix red chilli powder, ginger garlic paste, salt and curd.
Add the raw chicken pieces to the marinade and mix well. Keep it in the refrigerator overnight or minimum 6 hours.
Roast the marinated chicken in a tandoor or an oven for about 10-12 minutes until it is three-fourth done.
For the chicken gravy
Heat half the quantity of white butter in pan.
Pour in the tomato puree, and saute for 2-3 minutes. Add cumin seeds, sugar, red chilli powder and salt. Mix well.
Add the prepared chicken, white butter, fresh cream, sliced green chillies and crushed fenugreek leaves.  Saute for 3-4 minutes and let the chicken cook.
Cook till chicken is done. Serve hot with rice or naan.

name: Fish Pulao
instructions: Mix the turmeric, chilli powder, salt, ginger, garlic, onion, garam masala and half a cup of yogurt and marinate the fish in it, for half an hour.
Heat the oil and pan fry the fish till brown and cooked through. Take off the heat and mix in the rest of the yogurt, cream, hara dhania and half the fried onions.
Place half the rice in a greased pan in a layer. Place the fish mixture in a layer over this and cover with the rest of the rice.
Seal the pan and place over low heat for 20-30 minutes.
Serve hot garnished with the rest of the fried onions.

name: Prawn and Sesame Toast
instructions: Add lemon juice to prawns.
Puree the fish fillets with gin, egg white and salt.
Beat in hung yoghurt and stir in onions, chilli powder and prawns.
Spread the paste on the toast and coat with sesame seeds.
Bake in a preheated oven at 200 degrees C for 15-20 minutes or till sesame is coloured.
Serve warm on a bed of salad leaves.

name: Thai Steamed Fish
instructions: Thai marinade paste:
Put all the ingredients in a grinder and grind all together.
Finish it off with lemon juice and keep aside.
For the steam fish:1. Smother oil on a silver foil and add Thai marinade paste on it.
Lay some fresh beans over the top and lay marinated fish over it.
Nicely foil it all together giving a little space over the top.
Put it in a preheat oven and cook away for 10-12 minutes at 200 degrees.
Serve it on a platter.

name: Stir Fried Prawns
instructions: For the stir fried prawns:
Drizzle olive oil in a preheated pan and add the prawns and stir-fry.
Take out the prawns when it turns golden brown.
Heat the pan again and drizzle oil and add ginger, spring onion, red chili and fennel seeds.
Cook it all together.
Add the fried prawns into the pan and saute it.
Add sweet chili sauce, soya sauce, lemon juice, cucumber and coriander and mix them all together. Cook it away for 2 minutes.
Serve it in a platter with noodles.
For the noodles:
Bring the water to a boil.
Add the plain noodles and a pinch of salt. Once it has cooked filter the water.
Add some refined oil and chopped coriander leaves and chopped spring onions.
Serve it in a platter.

name: Red Snapper with Pesto & Asparagus
ingredients: 1 fillet of red snapper with skin
For the asparagus and mushroom layer:
instructions: For the snapper:
Cut the fillet in two pieces and drizzle olive oil on each.
Massage the oil into the flesh of the fish and season with salt & pepper.        For the pesto:
In a grinder throw in parsley leaves, ginger, garlic cloves, almonds.
Season it with chili flakes, olive oil, parmesan cheese and salt and pepper.
Pulse the grinder and then transfer into a bowl.
Garnish with extra virgin olive oil and lemon juice.For the asparagus and mushroom layer:
Take a handful of asparagus and chop them at an angle. In a regular pan heat up olive oil and add mushrooms, asparagus & almonds.
Season with salt and pepper and finish it off with butter.
For frying the fish:

In a non- stick pan, heat some olive oil and fry the fish skin down till golden. Turn it over and turn down the heat. Cook only for a minute or so and add butter for color and flavor. Then add lime juice.
Plating it up:
Add 1 1/2 Tbsp of pesto at the bottom.
Then add a layer of mushrooms, asparagus and almonds.
Seasons it with salt and pepper.

name: Rava Fried Fish
instructions: Marinate fish in chilli powder, salt, tamarind, turmeric and garlic for about 15 minutes.
Heat oil.
Dip fish in soojee to coat on both sides and deep fry till crisp and brown.
Serve hot.

name: Fish Tikka Salad
ingredients: Few medium bunch Lolla Rossa lettuce
Extra virgin olive oil in 1:4 ratio of acidity to oil
instructions: De-seed the red pepper and julienne it.
Halve the mushrooms and the baby potatoes.
Heat up a pan and add 2 tsp of olive oil.
Put mushrooms in the pan and saute them. Season with salt & pepper. Cook till mushrooms are slightly charred.
Add 1 tsp of butter and transfer to a bowl.
To sear the fish tikkas put them in a pan, add 3 tsp of butter and some drops of olive oil. Add salt to season. Saute until slightly crispy.
Slice 5 -6 grapes in half.
Transfer fish tikka to a bowl. Add salt & pepper to season. Add grapes, olives sliced in half and finely chopped spring onions.
Finally add some chopped lettuce.
For the dressing:
Whisk the lime juice, salt, pepper, honey together and the dressing is ready
Add 3-4 tsp of extra virgin olive oil to the salad
Add the dressing
Garnish with spring onions and serve.

name: Machchli Masala
ingredients: 1 kg fish like a pomfret, or part of a larger fish, in one piece, scaled and cleaned but skin kept intact
1 tsp salt and 2 tsp lemon juice
Lemon juice and chaat masala for garnish
instructions: Make slits along the length of the fish, on one side, going deep into the fish, along the bone, but not cutting through the opposite side-- thus creating a pocket. Repeat on the other side of the bone, and you will have two such pockets on either side of the bone of the fish.
Apply the salt and the lemon juice to the fish inside out, leave for about 15 minutes and wash off. Drain and wipe dry.
Apply the ground paste all over the fish, inside too. Heat the oil to high, and add the fish to it, browning over high heat, first on one side then the other.
Lower the heat, cover and cook till cooked through (10-15 minutes, depending on the thickness of the fish.)
Transfer on to a serving dish, garnish with the lemon juice and chaat masala and serve.

name: Batter Fried Fish with Cheese Sauce
ingredients: 2 Tbsp all purpose flour for dusting
instructions: Marinate fish, lemon juice and salt for 5 minutes and wash off.
From the batter ingredients, mix together the flour, salt and oil. Add the water gradually, mix into a batter and keep aside.

Heat oil and add flour. Saute till flour emanates an aroma. Take pan off the fire and add milk, stirring vigorously all the time to avoid lumps. Put pan back over heat and bring to a boil, stirring continuously. Season with salt and pepper and add the cheese to mix well. Take off the heat and keep aside.
Wash and wipe the fish dry. Dust lightly with flour, patting off any excess flour.
Heat oil for frying, and while it is heating, whip egg-white stiff and fold into the batter.
When oil is ready, dip the fish into the batter, shake off the excess and fry to a very light golden on both sides. Place it on an absorbent paper to drain off the excess fat.

Immediately before serving, fry the fish once again in hot oil, drain and arrange in a serving dish. Pour some of the hot cheese sauce over it (serving the rest of it on the side) and garnish with the greens.

name: Prawn Sesame Toast
ingredients: 2 tsp red chili, de-seeded and finely chopped
instructions: Gently pound the prawns and fish sauce till the prawns are finely mashed.
Add the red chilli, coriander and garlic, mix well.
Cut out three small circles in each bread slice by using ring mould.
Neatly top each circle with a generous amount of prawn mixture.
Dip the bread from the topping side into the sesame seeds.
Then deep fry till it is golden brown in color.
Serve hot.

Tip: I normally like to add just a wee bit of palm sugar in the prawn mixture, and in case you find the mixture falling off the bread, when you are frying, just add a tsp of egg yolk to the prawn mixture to bind it together.

name: Mayawatis Prawn Curry
ingredients: 10-15 Goan dried red chili or any dry red chilli
instructions: Grind all the ingredients for the paste together, sprinkling a bit of water if required.
Heat the oil in a pan, saute the onions and green chilli till light brown.
Add the spice paste and stir for 5 minutes on medium heat.
Then mix in the prawns and coat well with the paste.
Pour in some water and bring it to a boil.
Finally add tomatoes and salt, stir it for 2 minutes.
Cover let it cook for 10 minutes on low heat.
Serve hot with steamed rice.
Tip - In case you don't have kokum, just use 2 Tbsp. of tamarind water instead. Although this recipe is traditionally for prawn curry it works very well for baby onions and drumsticks.

name: Chilli Fish
instructions: Cut the fish into finger pieces.
Make a batter with corn flour, maida, baking powder, soy sauce, celery, pepper powder, water and salt.
Dip the fish pieces in the batter and fry in oil till golden brown. Transfer fish into a serving plate.
For the sauce:
Heat oil in a pan.
Saute garlic, ginger and green chilly. Add soy sauce, chilly and tomato sauce to it.
Finally add corn flour mixed with water to it and stir well. Once it starts to boil, remove form fire.
At the time of serving, pour the sauce on top of fried fish pieces and mix well.
Garnish with chopped spring onions.

name: Batter Fish
ingredients: 500 grams, any white firm flesh fish fillet (River sole or Sea bass)
instructions: Clean the fish under running water, pat dry and roll it in flour and parsley, keep aside
For the batter , in a clean bowl whisk together soda water, baking powder, egg, flour and the seasoning into smooth consistencyHeat the oil in wok/ deep pan
Now dip each piece of fish in batter, coating them well and gently place them into hot oil.Fry on medium heat till golden
Serve with a wedge of lemon, Chips with salt and vinegar.
Tip: For an airer, lighter texture, I sometimes make the batter with beer instead of soda water. This works wonderfully!

name: Peri-Peri & Panko Crumbed Prawns
instructions: Clean and de-vein the prawns.
Marinate prawns with salt, lemon juice and peri-peri chilly powder. (for about 10-15 minutes)
After marination add salt and lemon juice. Mix well.
Make a batter with egg and flour. (or water and flour)
Now dip the marinated prawns in the batter and crumb with panko.
Deep fry in medium heated oil till it turns to golden brown in color and is cooked well from inside.
Garnish with chopped coriander and serve with lemon wedge.

name: Koliwada Prawns
ingredients: 1 tsp cayenne pepper powder (substitute with kashmiri chilli)
instructions: Shell the prawns, remove the tails if desired, de-vein and wash well. Cut the fish into cubes and wash well. Pat both dry with paper towels.
For the batter, take a bowl and mix the cayenne pepper powder, garam masala, carom seeds, salt (to taste), coriander leaves, ginger paste, garlic paste, red food coloring and lime juice together.
Add the seafood and coat well with the batter. Then coat each piece well in rice flour.
Heat oil on high heat in a pot. Then reduce the heat to medium and fry each piece of seafood for 3-4 minutes till golden and cooked.
Serve hot.

name: Pan Seared Trout
instructions: For the marinade:
Mix half a teaspoon of salt, dill leaves, coriander seeds, chili flakes, two teaspoon lime juice and mustard oil.
Let the fish marinate for ten minutes. Cook in the pan for about 7 and a half minutes.
For the sauce:Bring 2 Tbsp of mustard oil to smoking temperature in a pan. Add black mustard seeds and wait for them to crackle.
Add onions and saute them. Take the pan off the flame and add fresh coriander leaves, 2 tsp lime juice and salt to taste.
Pour the sauce over the fish. Serve with laccha onions and fresh lettuce and carrot.

name: Beer Battered Fish
instructions: For the fish:

Take yeast in a bowl and add a pinch of sugar and a little water. Put this mixture in the microwave for 5-6 seconds. Add 3 tbsp heaped flour, beer, salt and pepper to the mixture. Whisk it till it has a slightly thick consistency and let it rest for a few minutes.
Take the fish fillet and sprinkle a touch of salt on both sides. Dust with a little flour on both sides and dip it in the risen batter.
Fry in hot oil till it's a golden brown on both sides.
For the potato salad:

Boil and peel the small potatoes. Put them in a bowl and add beans, spring onions, jalapeno juice, jalapenos, olives, gherkins, green pepper, mayonnaise, mustard, chives, parsley leaves and tarragon leaves.
Season with salt and pepper to taste.
Chill before serving.
For the pea puree:
Place butter in a pan. Add onions and peas. Season with salt and pepper to taste. Saute the mixture very lightly.
Put the mixture in a blender, add vinegar and blend.
Serve the fish with cold potato salad and fresh pea puree. Add slices of lemon and garnish with fresh parsley.

name: Karwari Prawns
instructions: For the Prawns:
In a bowl, add lemon juice, chilli powder, salt, turmeric powder, tamarind water and mix well. Add prawns to the mixture and let marinate for 30 minutes.
Now dab the marinated prawns in suji and press them well with your palm. Keep the prawns aside for 10 minutes to let the suji stick well and make it crisp.
Then fry the prawns in hot oil for 2-2 and a half minutes on both sides. Remove when done and serve hot with chutney.
For the chutney:
Heat the pan and add oil, button red chilli, curry leaves, chilli powder, turmeric powder and mix coconut paste.

name: Chocolate Cake in a Pressure Cooker
instructions: In a mixing bowl, sift the flour, cocoa powder and baking powder.
Add in the butter, sugar, salt, water and vanilla, and beat the ingredients using a whisk.
Add the eggs and beat the batter until smooth.
Transfer into the baking tin.
Heat the pressure cooker, covered with the lid but without the pressure, for 3-4 minutes on high heat, then place the cake tin in the empty cooker (do not add water in the cooker).
Close the lid (without the pressure), lower the flame and let it cook until done (about 30 minutes).

name: Honey Chilli Potatoes
instructions: For the potatoes:
In a bowl, add cornflour or maida, salt and red chilli powder.
Add the sliced potatoes and mix well until the potatoes are coated.
Heat oil in a wok and deep fry the potatoes until golden. Keep aside.
For the Base:
In a wok, add oil, garlic paste and spring onions. Saute on high heat for 1 minute.
Add capsicum, honey, salt, soya sauce, chilli sauce. Saute for 2-3 minutes.
Add the deep-fried potatoes and sesame seeds. Mix well and serve hot.

name: Vegetable Momos
instructions: Mix the maida, salt and baking powder and knead to a stiff dough with water.
Heat oil and add the onion and garlic.
Saute over high heat and add the carrot and cabbage. Turn around over high heat till glossy.
Take it off the heat and mix in the Soya sauce, salt, vinegar and black pepper.
Roll the dough thin (translucent) and cut into 4"-5" rounds.
Take a round, wet edges and place some filling in the center.
Bring edges together to cover the filling. Twist to seal and fill the rest in the same way.
Steam for about 10 minutes and serve with soya sauce and chilli sauce.
